New Records: Jake Rogers hit two home runs in the first three innings, contributing to his 19 homers this season and achieving a pair of multihomer games.
Nolan Schanuel extended his club-record on-base streak to 22 games at the start of his career.
Key Match Events: Jake Rogers hit a solo homer in the second inning and a three-run homer in the third inning, giving Detroit a 5-0 lead.
Joey Wentz won for the second time in 16 appearances since May 14, giving up three runs and five hits in 4 1/3 innings.
Alex Lange pitched a perfect ninth for his 24th save in 29 chances.
Randal Grichuk hit his 15th homer for the Angels, a two-run drive in the sixth inning.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Los Angeles Angels were assured their eighth consecutive losing season.
The Tigers completed a three-game sweep at Anaheim for the first time since Aug. 16-18, 1993.
Scheduled starter Reid Detmers was scratched by the Angels because of illness.
Angels' 2B Kyren Paris was a late scratch because of thumb soreness.
RHP Chase Silseth continued his recovery with a start for Triple-A Salt Lake on Sunday.
